entry.title: New year, new reading resolutions
entry.summary: As I get older, I have become more intentional in selecting the books with which I choose to spend my time. At the beginning of the year, I think about what I want to read and why.

entry.title: Roseburg Warming Center Activated Saturday Night With Delayed Opening After 7 PM
entry.summary: The Roseburg Warming Center will be activated Saturday night, Jan. 24, with delayed check-in after 7 p.m. and overnight hours from 9 p.m. to 6:30 a.m. Space is first-come, first-served at St. Joseph’s Gymnasium in Roseburg.

entry.title: Police Log: January 22, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations in incidents spanning Jan. 22-23, including several warrant arrests, a DUII arrest, a burglary tools case, and multiple city ordinance and camping violations, according to the city’s daily police logs.

entry.title: "The Power of Place" photography exhibit comes to Roseburg Public Library
Reedsport Main Street program advances to Designated Main Street tier
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Oregon Main Street (OMS) announced that four Oregon-based associations have advanced to the next tier of the Oregon Main Street Network. Among them, one Douglas County town's Main Street program was chosen for the honor.

entry.title: Winston-Dillard SD teaches students table etiquette when dining fine
entry.summary: WINSTON — Fifth grade student Hayden Shryock said he was surprised it took him "a decade" to learn about polite dining.

entry.title: Deputy’s Patrol Vehicle Struck During Late-Night Stop Attempt Near Riddle, Court Records Say
entry.summary: Riddle man Damien Tobias Saltzman, 45, was jailed after deputies reported a late-night crash on Boyer Road, a short vehicle pursuit, and a collision with a sheriff’s vehicle. No injuries were reported. Charges include DUII and felony attempting to elude.

entry.title: OREGON’S UNEMPLOYMENT RATE WAS 5.2 PERCENT IN DECEMBER
entry.summary: January 23, 2026 3:50 a.m. Oregon’s unemployment rate was 5.2 percent in both November and December. The U.S. unemployment rate was 4.5 percent in November and 4.4 percent in December. A State of Oregon Employment Department release said in December, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment dropped by 2,200 jobs, following a gain of 800...

entry.title: Roseburg Benefit Car Show Returns March 14 and 15, Raising Funds for Search and Rescue and Local Children in Need
entry.summary: The 47th Annual Roseburg Benefit Car Show returns March 14-15, 2026 at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. Proceeds benefit Douglas County Search and Rescue and the Special Equipment Fund for children with disabilities. Vehicle entries due Feb. 20 at strayangelscarclub.com.

entry.title: Veterans Affairs in-person mental health care services reduced due to ongoing protests
entry.summary: Veterans will no longer be able to receive in-person mental health care services at the Old Federal Building on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. And according to a local veteran, it's because of continued protests at the building.

entry.title: Douglas County highlights park safety upgrades with Wi-Fi, updated life vest stations, and new camera at Chief Miwaleta
entry.summary: Douglas County officials say safety upgrades are underway at several parks, including new Wi Fi in low cell coverage areas, updated life vest stations at boat ramps, and a live streaming camera at Chief Miwaleta County Park near Galesville Reservoir to show lake and launch conditions.

entry.title: Studio Arts Connection bringing watercolor, yarn arts, jewelry making, and gallery space to Roseburg
entry.summary: Studio Arts Connection is opening soon in Roseburg at 1350 NE Stephens St. #10, next to Subway. Owner Sharon Bedford will offer watercolor, knitting, crochet, jewelry-making, and open studio time. First class is Feb. 4 with a Valentine card watercolor project.

entry.title: Johnny Barrett of Riddle Earns Eagle Scout Rank After Completing 236 Hour Service Project
entry.summary: Johnny Barrett of Troop 36 in Riddle has earned the rank of Eagle Scout after completing a 236 hour service project building benches for a local baseball field. Barrett plans to graduate in 2026 and is pursuing dual credit coursework in UCC’s Mechatronics program.

entry.title: Roseburg literacy event offers free books and fun for families
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools is hosting an exciting early childhood literacy event on Monday. This initiative is part of the district's efforts to boost literacy development across the community.

entry.title: New Lemur House Completed at Wildlife Safari, Lemurs Return to Walk Thru Safari
entry.summary: Wildlife Safari has completed a brand new lemur house in the free Walk Thru Safari. The larger, heated space includes big windows and can be divided for new introductions or maternity needs. The lemurs have returned to their updated island home.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01.22.26
entry.summary: Live from Washington D.C. fourth district Congresswoman Val Hoyle talks about federal forestry policy, continued work on getting funding for a state veterans home in Roseburg, and a variety of other topics.

entry.title: Douglas County Board of Commissioners address human trafficking awareness, disaster relief funding and more
entry.summary: On Wednesday, the Douglas County Board of Commissioners held a meeting in which service was recognized, human trafficking awareness was discussed and next steps on disaster relief funding for the March 2025 floods were taken.

entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care has given notice that one of its third-party vendors has reported a possible data breach.

entry.title: Source One Serenity Honors Douglas County Leaders With Certificate of Appreciation
entry.summary: Source One Serenity founders Rusty and Elena Lininger presented Douglas County Commissioners and Solid Waste staff with a certificate of appreciation, thanking them for support that helped launch a food waste diversion and compost project at the Glide Transfer Station.

entry.title: Reedsport Main Street advances to “Designated Main Street” level in Oregon Main Street Network
entry.summary: Reedsport Main Street advanced to the Designated Main Street level in the Oregon Main Street Network, along with Downtown Medford Association, North Bend Main Street, and Port Orford Main Street. OMS said the designation reflects progress in strengthening historic downtowns.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01/21/26
entry.summary: Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation Executive Director Carma Mornarich talks about their recent grants to over 90 non-profit organizations in the region.

entry.title: Douglas County Declares January as Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention Month
entry.summary: Douglas County commissioners issued a proclamation Jan. 21, 2026, declaring January as National Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention Month. The proclamation cites the TVPA and recognizes the Douglas County Human Trafficking Task Force and its partner agencies.

entry.title: Congress approves FY26 Interior Appropriations bill with changes to O&C timber revenue share for Oregon counties
entry.summary: Congress approved the FY26 Interior Appropriations Bill with language that AOCC says restores a 75% share of BLM O&C timber receipts for 18 western Oregon counties. The group says the change reverses a 1982 revision and could boost annual revenue by about 50%.

entry.title: Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU
entry.summary: Southern Oregon University’s project to create an older adult living community on its Ashland campus has been paused after one of the two companies being considered as partners with the university withdrew its response to SOU’s request for proposal. SOU will take time to consider what potential partnerships may look like before possibly issuing a new request for… The post Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.21.26
entry.summary: Erin Maidlow of Umpqua Valley Farm to School talks about garden plots that are available at the Umpqua Dairy Garden.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Alleged BB Gun Robbery, Witness Tampering
entry.summary: Roseburg police arrested a 32-year-old man after officers reported he pointed a BB gun at a woman, demanded her wallet, and later contacted her about the case. He was lodged at Douglas County Corrections on robbery, weapon, and witness tampering charges.

entry.title: Police Log: January 20, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations in the latest logs, including a first degree robbery allegation involving a BB gun, several warrant and probation contacts, and city ordinance cases such as prohibited camping and leash law violations.

entry.title: North Umpqua Outfitters Offering Free Umpqua River Fishing Trip for Veterans and First Responders
entry.summary: North Umpqua Outfitters is offering a free guided fishing trip on the Umpqua River for veterans and first responders. The drift boat outing includes fishing gear, lunch, and drinks, and lasts about 5 to 6 hours. Participants must bring an Oregon fishing license and Salmon Steelhead tag.

entry.title: Drain's Ray's Food Place to close by end of February
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Drain resident Nancy Whitlock was out for a morning walk when she passed the Ray's Food Place and saw a new sign hanging from the side of the building, which reads "Store Closing. Everything Must Go!"

entry.title: UACT organizing father/daughter dance, tickets now on sale
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Umpqua Actors Community Theatre is now organizing the Douglas County Father/Daughter Winter Wonderland Dance.

entry.title: 55th annual Greatest of the Grape tickets on sale
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Tickets are now on sale for the 55th annual Greatest of the Grape event.

entry.title: Maintenance inspection to briefly close Stewart Park Drive Bridge
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg will be closed to vehicle and pedestrian traffic during a maintenance inspection on Thursday.

entry.title: Partnership to host great horned owl researcher
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Umpqua Valley Audubon and Roseburg Public Library invite the public to a presentation on great horned owls by Colorado researcher Scott Rashid.

entry.title: UCC Women’s Basketball Coach Dave Stricklin Earns 1,000th Career Win in Riverhawks Victory
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College women’s basketball coach Dave Stricklin earned the 1,000th win of his junior college career Jan. 19 as the Riverhawks beat Portland Community College 89-60. UCC will recognize the milestone with an on-court ceremony Jan. 25.

entry.title: Roseburg library hosts photography exhibit
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Public Library invites the community to enjoy “The Power of Place,” a photography exhibit currently on loan from the Oregon Historical Society.

entry.title: North Douglas County Fire & EMS Receives Two SPIRE Grants for New Rescue Tools and Thermal Drone
entry.summary: North Douglas County Fire & EMS received two SPIRE grants from Oregon Emergency Management, funding new Holmatro battery rescue tools for vehicle extrication and a thermal imaging drone to boost search and rescue and scene awareness. Crews are now training with the equipment.

entry.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care Notifies Patients of Vendor-Related Security Incident Involving TriZetto
entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care says a vendor-related security incident at TriZetto may have involved some patient info, including names, SSNs, and insurance details. Adapt systems were not breached. Impacted patients will be notified starting Feb. 2026.

entry.summary: January 21, 2026 4:00 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory remains in effect until 10:00 a.m. Wednesday for central Douglas County. Dense fog could lower visibilities and make driving conditions hazardous, especially over higher...

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS UNTIL 4:00 P.M. WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: January 21, 2026 3:50 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory remains in effect until 4:00 p.m. Wednesday within the valleys in Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said poor air quality will continue. This is due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions near the surface that will continue to trap pollutants....

entry.summary: January 21, 2026 3:40 a.m. Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg will be closed to vehicle and pedestrian traffic during a maintenance inspection on Thursday. entry.title: NORTH DOUGLAS COUNTY FIRE & EMS RECEIVES TWO GRANTS
entry.summary: January 21, 2026 3:05 a.m. North Douglas County Fire & EMS has been awarded two grants through the Oregon Emergency Management State Preparedness and Incident Response Equipment program. entry.title: PACIFIC POWER FOUNDATION AWARDS GRANTS FOR ARTS AND CULTURE ORGANIZATIONS
entry.summary: January 21, 2026 2:50 a.m. The Pacific Power Foundation has awarded grants to 63 arts and culture organizations in Oregon, Washington, and northern California. entry.summary: Presented by Littlejohn Financial, David Littlejohn and Matt Dickson have our weekly local financial program.

entry.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg closes for inspection Thursday
entry.summary: Stewart Park Drive Bridge will be closed for a maintenance inspection on Thursday, Jan. 22.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 01/20/26
entry.summary: Dr. Liz Fiedler Mergen talks about her grief journey following the death of her husband right before she found out she was pregnant in 2020. Her book “Flowers Bloom Anyway” is out soon and is available for pre-order from Barnes and Noble.

entry.title: NLRB Dismisses Union Complaints Against Bigfoot Beverages, Company Says
entry.summary: Bigfoot Beverages says the NLRB dismissed seven unfair labor practice charges filed by Teamsters Locals 206 and 324, calling them lacking in merit. The strike began Sept. 19, 2024, and continues as the labor dispute remains unresolved.

entry.title: Police Log: January 16 - January 20, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests Jan. 16 to 20, including DUII cases, warrants and parole violations, alleged assaults and harassment, restraining or no contact order violations, theft at WinCo, and several criminal mischief and prohibited camping incidents, according to city logs.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.20.26
entry.summary: State Representative Boomer Wright talks about his plans to retire from the Oregon State Legislature after this term. He talks about his work in Salem and plans for the future.

entry.title: MLK Day of Service Brings Roseburg Together for River Cleanup and Invasive Species Removal
entry.summary: Roseburg volunteers marked MLK Day with hands-on service across Stewart Park, Eastwood Nature Park, and the Duck Pond, removing trash, pulling invasive plants, and installing educational signs as part of Umpqua Watersheds’ annual restoration event.
